  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 19

Words 1801-1900

  1. online
    She prefers to shop online rather than visit stores.

  2. only
    This is the only book I need for the class.

  3. onto
    He climbed onto the roof to fix the leak.

  4. open
    The store will open at 9 a.m. tomorrow.

  5. opening
    The opening of the new park was a big event.

  6. operate
    Doctors operate on patients to save lives.

  7. operation
    The operation was successful, and the patient is recovering.

  8. opinion
    Everyone has a different opinion about the movie.

  9. opponent
    The opponent played very well in the final match.

  10. opportunity
    This is a great opportunity to learn something new.

  11. oppose
    Many people oppose the new law.

  12. opposed
    She is strongly opposed to the idea of cutting down trees.

  13. opposite
    The bank is located opposite the supermarket.

  14. opposition
    There was strong opposition to the proposed changes.

  15. option
    You have the option to choose between tea and coffee.

  16. or
    Would you like tea or coffee?

  17. orange
    She peeled an orange and shared it with her friend.

  18. order
    Please place your order at the counter.

  19. ordinary
    It was just an ordinary day at work.

  20. organ
    The heart is an important organ in the human body.

  21. organization
    The organization helps people in need.

  22. organize
    They plan to organize a meeting next week.

  23. organized
    She is very organized and keeps her desk tidy.

  24. organizer
    The organizer of the event did a great job.

  25. origin
    The origin of the story is unknown.

  26. original
    This is the original version of the painting.

  27. originally
    The building was originally a school.

  28. other
    Do you have any other questions?

  29. otherwise
    Hurry up, otherwise we will miss the bus.

  30. ought
    You ought to apologize for your mistake.

  31. our
    This is our favorite place to visit.

  32. ours
    The house next door is ours.

  33. ourselves
    We enjoyed ourselves at the party.

  34. out
    He went out to buy some groceries.

  35. outcome
    The outcome of the game was unexpected.

  36. outdoor
    They enjoy outdoor activities like hiking and camping.

  37. outdoors
    Let’s eat outdoors while the weather is nice.

  38. outer
    The outer layer of the cake was made of chocolate.

  39. outline
    She gave an outline of the project during the meeting.

  40. outside
    The children are playing outside in the garden.

  41. oven
    She baked a cake in the oven.

  42. over
    The plane flew over the mountains.

  43. overall
    Overall, the trip was a great success.

  44. owe
    I owe him money for the lunch he paid for.

  45. own
    She wants to own a house someday.

  46. owner
    The owner of the shop is very friendly.

  47. pace
    He walked at a slow pace to enjoy the view.

  48. pack
    Don’t forget to pack your clothes for the trip.

  49. package
    The package was delivered to my house this morning.

  50. page
    Please turn to page 10 in your book.

  51. pain
    He felt a sharp pain in his leg after the fall.

  52. painful
    The injury was very painful, but it healed quickly.

  53. paint
    She decided to paint the walls blue.

  54. painter
    The painter worked on the mural for weeks.

  55. painting
    The painting in the museum is very famous.

  56. pair
    I bought a new pair of shoes yesterday.

  57. palace
    The king lives in a beautiful palace.

  58. pale
    She looked pale after staying up all night.

  59. pan
    He cooked the vegetables in a large pan.

  60. panel
    The panel of judges announced the winner.

  61. pants
    He bought a new pair of pants for the interview.

  62. paper
    Please write your name on the top of the paper.

  63. paragraph
    The first paragraph of the essay is very interesting.

  64. parent
    Every parent wants the best for their children.

  65. park
    They went to the park to have a picnic.

  66. parking
    Finding parking in the city can be difficult.

  67. parliament
    The parliament will discuss the new law tomorrow.

  68. part
    This is the best part of the movie.

  69. participant
    Each participant received a certificate after the event.

  70. participate
    She decided to participate in the competition.

  71. particular
    Is there a particular reason why you are late?

  72. particularly
    I particularly enjoyed the dessert at the restaurant.

  73. partly
    The delay was partly due to bad weather.

  74. partner
    He is my business partner in the new company.

  75. party
    They are planning a big party for her birthday.

  76. pass
    Please pass the salt to me.

  77. passage
    The passage in the book was very moving.

  78. passenger
    The passenger on the train was reading a book.

  79. passion
    She has a passion for painting and spends hours on it.

  80. passport
    Don’t forget to bring your passport for the trip.

  81. past
    In the past, people used to write letters by hand.

  82. path
    The path through the forest was narrow and winding.

  83. patient
    The doctor asked the patient to rest for a few days.

  84. pattern
    The dress has a beautiful floral pattern.

  85. pay
    He needs to pay the bill before leaving the restaurant.

  86. payment
    The payment for the service was made online.

  87. peace
    The treaty brought peace to the region.

  88. peaceful
    The village is a peaceful place to live.

  89. pen
    She used a blue pen to write the letter.

  90. pencil
    He drew a picture with a pencil.

  91. penny
    She found a penny on the ground.

  92. pension
    He receives a pension after retiring from his job.

  93. people
    Many people attended the concert last night.

  94. pepper
    She added some pepper to the soup for flavor.

  95. per
    The speed limit is 60 miles per hour on this road.

  96. percentage
    A large percentage of the population supports the new policy.

  97. perfect
    The weather today is perfect for a picnic.

  98. perfectly
    The plan worked perfectly, and everyone was happy.

  99. perform
    The band will perform at the festival tomorrow.

  100. performance
    Her performance in the play was outstanding.
